data.title: DRACULA: Dimensionality Reduction And Clustering for Unsupervised Learning in Astronomy
data.name: DRACULA

evidence: "DRACULA - Dimensionality Reduction And Clustering for Unsupervised Learning in Astronomy" and "Pipeline to use all methods of data reduction and clustering." indicate it is an analysis pipeline users run, i.e., an application.

Usage is via commands like `DRAC_ALL`, `DRAC_REDUCTION`, `DRAC_CLUSTERING` after setting PATH and copying config files, showing it is executed as an end-user program for scientific analysis, directly producing clustering and plots used in research.

Environment preparation and usage are described in terms of cloning/using the "pipeline dir" and shell commands; there is no mention of PyPI, CRAN, or other package registries or binaries, implying distribution via the source repository.
